meanings.definition: The act of borking someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The borkings of the machine were loud and disruptive.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the constant borkings in the office.
meanings.sent3: The borkings of the clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The borkings of the old car echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The borkings of the clock were a reminder of time passing.

meanings.sent1: His borkings were evident from the way he walked.
meanings.sent2: The borkings of the system led to chaos.
meanings.sent3: The borkings of the cat made it look funny.
meanings.sent4: The borkings of the storm left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The borkings of the tree showed its age and wear.

meanings.definition: To bork something, causing it to malfunction or fail.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally borkings the computer by spilling water on it.
meanings.sent2: The virus borkings the entire network within minutes.
meanings.sent3: She borkings the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The storm borkings the power lines, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The magician borkings the trick, much to the audience's amusement.
